subject: Web3
title: What Is a DAO
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is a DAO.

hook.text: A DAO is an organization run by code and community votes instead of executives and boards. No CEO required.

buildup.text: DAO stands for Decentralized Autonomous Organization. Members hold tokens that let them propose and vote on decisions.

discovery.text: The rules are written in smart contracts. Funds are managed by code, not by a treasurer with a checkbook.

twist.text: In theory, DAOs are democratic. In practice, whoever holds the most tokens has the most power.

climax.text: DAOs are experimenting with a new form of organization â€” one without borders, offices, or hierarchies.

punchline.text: An organization with no boss, no office, and no borders.
